text: The Estrella Adobe Church, an adobe dwelling built in 1879, is a California Historical Landmark (#542). It fell into disuse and was in ruins when, according to the marker, the Paso Robles Women's Club History and Landmarks Committee restored the structure in 1952. On the property, there is an inactive cemetery with the earliest burials that appear to be 1882 and the latest burial is 1938.San Luis Obispo County Genealogical Society (October 29, 2015). Estrella Cemetery. Retrieved April 20, 2017. The Estrella–Pleasant Valley Public Cemetery District operates and maintains the cemetery.San Luis Obispo Local Agency Formation Commission (November 2010). Public Cemetery Districts of San Luis Obispo County, pg 29. Retrieved April 20, 2017. ==Landmark== Estrella Adobe Church was designated as a California Historical Landmark in 1955. == References == == External links == *Lynne Landwehr (2004). title: Estrella Adobe Church
